borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of its significant scale and siting represents an unsympathetic and uncharacteristic addition to the dwelling house and surrounding local character. The proposal is thereby detrimental to the character and appearance of the street scene, dwelling house and the distinctive Becontree Estate. The proposal is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.4 and 7.6, 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4, D8 and HC1 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2, CP3 and CR2 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020</p>

<div>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</div>
description: Retrospective construction of a single storey rear extension
